HAS_CAUSE: the energy of running water
SENTENCE: Erosion is a hydraulic action, derived from the energy of running water.
Basin morphometry is a function of stream order and drainage patterns.

HAS_CAUSE: that has broken from an ice shelf
HAS_LOCATION: that floats in the Ocean
SENTENCE: An iceberg is a piece of ice that has broken from an ice shelf and that floats in the Ocean.
Abrasion is a particle-by-particle erosion process and produces large amounts of silt-sized (0.002 - 0.0625 mm) sediments.

HAS_FUNCTION: that has sufficient permeability to allow water to flow through it
SENTENCE: An aquifer is defined as a body of rock or unconsolidated sediment that has sufficient permeability to allow water to flow through it.
The term arenite applies to a so-called clean sandstone, meaning one with less than 15% silt and clay.
A periglacial environment is defined as any place where the geomorphic processes related to the freezing of water occurs.

HAS_SIZE: an area that is equal to or greater than the area of a semicircle whose diameter is equal to the width of the baymouth|having a baymouth less than 24 nautical miles wide
SENTENCE: A bay is a water body having a baymouth less than 24 nautical miles wide and an area that is equal to or greater than the area of a semicircle whose diameter is equal to the width of the baymouth
An isolated system is a system that is completely cut off from its surroundings and that cannot therefore import or export matter or energy.
A fault is a fracture along which movement associated with an earthquake has taken place, one side of the fault moving differentially to the other side.

HAS_SIZE: no more than a few centimetres wide and deep
SENTENCE: Honeycomb weathering is a term used to describe numerous small pits or alveoli, no more than a few centimetres wide and deep, separated by an intricate network of narrow walls and resembling a honeycomb. weathering

HAS_CAUSE: gravity sliding and spreading
SENTENCE: Tectonic denudation is a term that describes the unloading of mountains by gravity sliding and spreading.
Permafrost is soil or rock that remains frozen for two or more consecutive years.

HAS_LOCATION: beneath a glacier
SENTENCE: A ground moraine is a blanket of mixed glacial sediments - mainly tills and other diamictons - formed beneath a glacier.

HAS_CAUSE: living coral polyps
SENTENCE: A coral reef is a ridge or mound built of the skeletal remains of generations of coral animals, upon which grow living coral polyps.
An atoll is a ring of coral reef and small sandy islands that encircles a shallow lagoon.
Weathering is a process of a slow continuous breakdown of rocks into smaller particles that are in equilibrium with the prevailing environment
Soil is a mixture of fine mineral fragments (including quartz and clay minerals), organic matter, and empty spaces that may be partially filled with water.

HAS_SIZE: less than a micron ( too small to see ) to as big as an apartment block
SENTENCE: A clast is a fragment of rock or mineral, ranging in size from less than a micron (too small to see) to as big as an apartment block.
The term preglacial landform refers to any landform older than a specified glaciation.

HAS_CAUSE: due to process overprinting
SENTENCE: Geomorphic generation is a part of the classification that allows for the recognition of more than one geomorphic process type or landform at any given location due to process overprinting.

HAS_FUNCTION: in which large jumps across thresholds break in upon small-scale fluctuations about a moving mean
SENTENCE: A dynamic metastable equilibrium is a combination of dynamic and metastable equilibria, in which large jumps across thresholds break in upon small-scale fluctuations about a moving mean.
Tephra is a term covering three types of pyroclastic material of differing grain size.
pH is a measure of the acidity or alkalinity of aqueous solutions.
Carbonation is a step in the complex weathering of many other minerals, such as in the hydrolysis of feldspar.
Laterite is a term used to describe weathering deposits rich in iron and aluminium.

HAS_FUNCTION: that acts against gravity and resists movement
SENTENCE: Friction is a force that acts against gravity and resists movement.
Drainage density is a measure of how frequently streams occur on the land surface.

HAS_LOCATION: that sits across a valley , often where a band of hard rock outcrops
SENTENCE: A riegel is a rock barrier that sits across a valley, often where a band of hard rock outcrops.

HAS_CAUSE: excavated by waves
HAS_LOCATION: in a zone of weakness on a cliff
SENTENCE: A sea cave is a hollow excavated by waves in a zone of weakness on a cliff.

HAS_LOCATION: that terminates in the sea
SENTENCE: A tidewater glacier is a glacier that terminates in the sea, where it usually ends in an ice cliff from which icebergs are discharged.
A light year is a unit of length, equal to just under 10 trillion km.

HAS_CAUSE: transported by a glacier and then deposited
SENTENCE: Moraine is a material transported by a glacier and then deposited.
Orogeny is a mountain building process whereas epeirogeny is continental building process.
Morphometric analysis is a method of extracting information from published maps.

HAS_FUNCTION: advance or retreat through the housing when depressed against a rough surface
SENTENCE: The profilometer is a comb equipped with fine, closely spaced teeth that advance or retreat through the housing when depressed against a rough surface.
Amino-acid geochronology is a relative-age dating technique based on the premise that proteins in bones and shells are affected by a number of chemical reactions that are partly time-dependent.

HAS_CAUSE: alluvial islands that divide flows at discharges up to bankfull
SENTENCE: An anabranching alluvial river is a system of mul tiple channels characterized by vegetated or oth erwise stable alluvial islands that divide flows at discharges up to bankfull.

HAS_CAUSE: sudden release of enormous pressure
HAS_LOCATION: surface of the earth
SENTENCE: An earthquake is a vibration or oscillation of the surface of the earth caused by sudden release of enormous pressure.
Coastal geomorphology is a branch of geomorphology in which the focus is on the area influenced by large bodies of water, including seas and oceans, and large lakes.

HAS_CAUSE: impulsive disturbance that displaces the water , rather than by the wind .
SENTENCE: A tsunami is a series of ocean waves of extremely long wave length and period that is generated by an impulsive disturbance that displaces the water, rather than by the wind.
Accuracy is a measure of how close an age is to the time of formation or death of the dated material.
Magnitude is a measure of the amount of energy released by an earthquake, and it is proportional to the area of the rupture surface and to the amount of displacement.

HAS_LOCATION: ascends toward the surface from the lowermantle
SENTENCE: A mantle plume is a column of hot rock (not magma) that ascends toward the surface from the lowermantle.
Clast shape is a measure of the overall shape of a particle.

HAS_FUNCTION: advance or retreat through the housing when depressed against a rough surface
SENTENCE: A profilometer is a comb equipped with fine, closely spaced teeth that advance or retreat through the housing when depressed against a rough surface.
Amino-acid geochronology is a relative-age dating technique based on the premise that proteins in bones and shells are affected by a number of chemical reactions that are partly time-dependent.

HAS_CAUSE: following disappearance of an intervening ocean .
HAS_FUNCTION: separating two non-subductable pieces of crust that are juxtaposed
SENTENCE: A suture is a surface or zone separating two non-subductable pieces of crust that are juxtaposed following disappearance of an intervening ocean.

HAS_CAUSE: because geologic evidence of small and moderate-sized earthquakes is rarely created or preserved near the surface
SENTENCE: A paleoseismic record is a record of large or great earthquakes (because geologic evidence of small and moderate-sized earthquakes is rarely created or preserved near the surface).

HAS_FUNCTION: move slowly under their own weight
SENTENCE: Glaciers are large masses of ice formed of compressed snow that move slowly under their own weight.

HAS_FORM: resistant , tabular bands within sedimentary beds
HAS_LOCATION: may cross beds to spread along other bedding planes
SENTENCE: Sills are concordant intrusions and frequently form resistant, tabular bands within sedimentary beds, although they may cross beds to spread along other bedding planes.
Laccoliths are sills that have thickened to produce domes.

HAS_LOCATION: seated in anticlinal crests and synclinal troughs
SENTENCE: Phacoliths are lens-shaped masses seated in anticlinal crests and synclinal troughs.
Blockfields are large expanses of coarse and angular rock rubble.

HAS_FUNCTION: drive into the sediment layer and enclose and retain a layer
SENTENCE: Grab samplers are buckets or segments that drive into the sediment layer and enclose and retain a layer.

HAS_CAUSE: uplifted or emplaced and exposed
HAS_LOCATION: earth's oceanic crust and the underlying upper mantle|continental crustal rocks
SENTENCE: Ophiolites are sections of the earth's oceanic crust and the underlying upper mantle that have been uplifted or emplaced and exposed within the continental crustal rocks.

HAS_LOCATION: where a continent , island arc , oceanic plateau , or other thick piece of crust on a downgoing plate arrives at a subduction zone .
SENTENCE: Collisions are zones where a continent, island arc, oceanic plateau, or other thick piece of crust on a downgoing plate arrives at a subduction zone.

Volcanic rift zones are belts of aligned volcanic vents and associated magma-induced extensional structures such as subparallel normal faults, anastomosing tensile cracks, monoclines, and eruptive fissure.
Landslides are disequilibrium landforms that change through time more rapidly than surrounding terrain.

HAS_FUNCTION: delineate a single geomorphic process or landform
SENTENCE: Consociations are map units which delineate a single geomorphic process or landform, depending on scale.
Placer deposits are mixtures of heavy metals with specific location, geomorphic principles have been applied other than any other phase of economic geology.

HAS_SIZE: ranging from less than a kilometre to hundreds of kilometres in size
SENTENCE: Nunataks are rock outcrops, ranging from less than a kilometre to hundreds of kilometres in size, surrounded by ice.

HAS_LOCATION: stored beneath a glacier or ice sheet as a subglacial lake .
SENTENCE: Jökulhlaups are outbursts of meltwater stored beneath a glacier or ice sheet as a subglacial lake.
Rock glaciers are lobes or tongues of frozen, angular rock and fine debris mixed with interstitial ice and ice lenses.

HAS_FUNCTION: through which volcanic gases are released at the surface
SENTENCE: Fumaroles are vents through which volcanic gases are released at the surface.

HAS_LOCATION: where groundwater emerges from the limestone|flows across the surface
SENTENCE: Karst springs are locations where groundwater emerges from the limestone and flows across the surface forming a stream or contained pool.

HAS_CAUSE: low-grade metamorphism of volcanic rocks
SENTENCE: Zeolites are silicate minerals that typically form during low-grade metamorphism of volcanic rocks.

HAS_CAUSE: intense frost action
HAS_LOCATION: mountainous regions , such as the Alps
SENTENCE: Aiguille is a sharply pointed rock outcrop or peak, very often produced by intense frost action in mountainous regions, such as the Alps.
Dissolution is the process whereby a rock, or parts of a rock, combine with water to form a solution.

HAS_LOCATION: formed where dune height is inhibited by unobstructed strong winds
SENTENCE: Dome dune is a low, circular or oval mound formed where dune height is inhibited by unobstructed strong winds.

HAS_FORM: opening towards the sea , typically through a funnel-shaped inlet
HAS_LOCATION: seaward
SENTENCE: Estuary is the seaward end of a river, opening towards the sea, typically through a funnel-shaped inlet, and usually subject to tidal movements and incursions of salt water from the sea.

HAS_FUNCTION: nourishes downdrift beaches by natural littoral currents or forces
SENTENCE: Feeder beach is a beach that is artificially widened and nourishes downdrift beaches by natural littoral currents or forces.

HAS_CAUSE: formed by subsidence , particularly as a result of the solution of evaporite beds .
SENTENCE: Flash is a depression formed by subsidence, particularly as a result of the solution of evaporite beds.

HAS_CAUSE: flow regime of the present river
SENTENCE: Floodplain is a relatively flat alluvial landform, constructed largely by the flow regime of the present river and subject to flooding.

HAS_FORM: step on a hillside|near parallel series
HAS_LOCATION: along the contours of a hillslope
SENTENCE: Terracette is a small terrace that forms a step on a hillside. They often occur in near parallel series running approximately along the contours of a hillslope.
Colloids are particles of organic and mineral substances that range in size from 1 to 100 nm.

HAS_CAUSE: ephemeral rivulets
HAS_LOCATION: hillside
SENTENCE: Rills are tiny hillside channels a few centimetres wide and deep that are cut by ephemeral rivulets.

HAS_LOCATION: mountainous terrain
SENTENCE: Cirques are typically armchair-shaped hollows that form in mountainous terrain.

HAS_FORM: shaped like crescents with the concavity facing the direction of ice flow
SENTENCE: Lunate features are fractures shaped like crescents with the concavity facing the direction of ice flow.

HAS_CAUSE: associated with lakes or former lakes
SENTENCE: Geer moraines or washboard moraines are series of small and roughly parallel ridges of till that are ordinarily associated with lakes or former lakes.

HAS_CAUSE: associated with lakes or former lakes
SENTENCE: Geer moraines or washboard moraines are series of small and roughly parallel ridges of till that are ordinarily associated with lakes or former lakes.

HAS_CAUSE: infilling of subglacial or englacial channels or by sedimentation in supraglacial channels|created by subglacial meltwater
SENTENCE: Eskers are the chief landform created by subglacial meltwater and form by the infilling of subglacial or englacial channels or by sedimentation in supraglacial channels.

HAS_CAUSE: groundwater injected at high pressure between icing layers
SENTENCE: Icing blisters are ice mounds created by groundwater injected at high pressure between icing layers.
Thermokarst is irregular terrain characterized by topographic depressions with hummocks between them.

HAS_LOCATION: periglacial
SENTENCE: Solifluction is an important periglacial process and forms sheets, lobes, terraces, and ploughing boulders.

HAS_CAUSE: piecemeal by the wind
SENTENCE: Dunes are collections of loose sand built piecemeal by the wind.

HAS_CAUSE: deflation of loose sand partly bound by plant roots
SENTENCE: Blowouts are depressions created by the deflation of loose sand partly bound by plant roots.

HAS_FUNCTION: connecting islands to the mainland or islands to islands
SENTENCE: Tombolos are wave-built ridges of beach material connecting islands to the mainland or islands to islands.
Tidal flats are banks of mud or sand that are exposed at low tide.
Greywackes are sandstones containing rock fragments and clay minerals.

HAS_CAUSE: collapse of the central part of a volcano .|powerful volcanic explosion
SENTENCE: Caldera is a large crater or depression resulting from a powerful volcanic explosion or the collapse of the central part of a volcano.

HAS_CAUSE: defined by the surrounding watershed|drained by a river
SENTENCE: Catchment is an area that is drained by a river and defined by the surrounding watershed.

HAS_LOCATION: furrows produced by avalanches on hill slopes|straits between the mainland and islands|rivers
SENTENCE: Chute is a narrow channel with a swift current, applied to rivers, the straits between the mainland and islands, and to furrows produced by avalanches on hill slopes.
Coquina is a carbonate rock which consists largely or wholly of mechanically sorted, weakly to moderately cemented fossil debris.

HAS_CAUSE: sub-surface weathering of a joint block
HAS_LOCATION: surrounded by saprolite
SENTENCE: Corestone is a spheroidal boulder of relatively unweathered rock surrounded by saprolite and formed by sub-surface weathering of a joint block.

HAS_CAUSE: by the impact of moving debris
SENTENCE: Corrasion is the mechanical erosion of rock surfaces by the impact of moving debris.
Corridor karst is a type of karst characterized by long, narrow chasms enlarged by the action of water and into which surface runoff or stream may flow.

HAS_CAUSE: as a result of solution .
HAS_LOCATION: areas underlain by limestone bedrock or calcrete
SENTENCE: Daya is a shallow depression found primarily in areas underlain by limestone bedrock or calcrete as a result of solution.

HAS_FORM: small ridges oriented perpendicular to the ice flow direction
SENTENCE: De Geer Moraine is a glacial landform consisting of swarms of small ridges oriented perpendicular to the ice flow direction.

HAS_CAUSE: wind abrasion
HAS_FORM: three distinct facets on its upper surface
HAS_LOCATION: surface in desert regions and periglacial areas
SENTENCE: Dreikanter is a shaped pebble found on the surface in desert regions and periglacial areas with three distinct facets on its upper surface as a result of wind abrasion.

HAS_CAUSE: has drifted from its point of origin
SENTENCE: Drift ice is any type of floating ice that has drifted from its point of origin and broken into pieces small enough for a ship to sail through.
Ferricrete is a type of duricrust consisting of an iron-pan or near-surface zone of iron sesquioxide cementation.

HAS_CAUSE: drowning of an undulating landscape of shallow valleys and low interfluves
HAS_LOCATION: coastal
SENTENCE: Fiard is a coastal inlet produced by the drowning of an undulating landscape of shallow valleys and low interfluves.

HAS_LOCATION: between the lowest low-water line and the average high-water mark
SENTENCE: Foreshore is the part of a coast lying between the lowest low-water line and the average high-water mark.
